leaflet.constituency: Bartley Green, Edgbaston, Harborne and Quinton

messages.title: A personal message from Dr Luke Evans
messages.content: Several sessions spent knocking on doors...I hope this leaflet...leads to a greater understanding and dialogue.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: You need to know what I think and why I think it. Simple.
As a doctor I'm fiercely proud of the values of the NHS. Long may it continue.
From primary to university level I know the value of quality teaching.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Labour plan to borrow risks the years.
Vince Cable: Lib Dems could enter coalition with Labour.

issues.economy: For job creators and savers. A better future for your family and our country.
issues.socialWelfare: Benefits cap 'leads where work pays'. Tax cuts for hard workers.

housing.content: Trust needs to be built by people who are entrusted to do it and by NHS users and taxpayers alike. I believe that compassionately helping others it what it comes down to.

leaflet.personalStatement: I passionately believe that we deliver for everyone because what makes the people of Edgbaston, Harborne, Bartley Green and Quinton tick, makes me tick. He represents me.

politicalExperience.role: Teaching anatomy at The University of Birmingham
School governor at a Primary School

contactInformation.address: Brigid Jones 56 Middleton Road Bartley Green B17 0AD

images.caption: Dr Luke Evans engaging in local community activities.

leaflet.additionalNotes: For a strong and compassionate MP who will be accountable to you, vote Dr Luke Evans on 7th May.
